s1: Cyber Security Foundations introduces all essential cyber security principles.
s2: Understanding of the process of identifying and formulating research problems.

s1: This includes principles of secure design, secrets minimization, least privilege, isolation, separation and encapsulation.
s2: This includes different tasks such as topic modelling, statistical analysis, applying different machine learning techniques to solve a problem in a team, proving theorems, complexity analysis, designing a research project, reviewing papers and presenting papers.

s1: The interplay between failed security principles and vulnerabilities is investigated in detail.
s2: Understanding of the process of identifying and formulating research problems.

s1: The course provides the essential foundations which allow students to continue in a more in-depth cyber security career, yet can also be used a standalone unit to provide a self-contained set of knowledge.
s2: The lectures will be complemented by a series of workshops, labs and assignments that require students to do some small research focused tasks that help them get a hands-on experience of research, both individually and in teams of students.

s1: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the fundamental principles underlying Cyber Security.
s2: Demonstrate an awareness of the existence of technological choices; and make appropriate choices based on a consideration of design criteria.

s1: Define and identify cyber security principles and their violation.
s2: Understanding of the process of identifying and formulating research problems.

s1: Apply cyber security principles in a practical context.
s2: Understanding of the process of identifying and formulating research problems.

s1: Migrate insights from cyber security analysis into new designs.
s2: Ability to carry out literature searches and some ability to critically evaluate literature.

s1: Communicate a cyber security thread to a heterogenous team of professionals.
s2: Demonstrate awareness of the importance of documenting all aspects of the development of an computing project of significant magnitude.
